5.47-3.4c.21-.12.44-.18.67-.18zm3.81-10.44zM12 18.09c.23 0 .46.06.66.19l5.47 3.4-1.47-6.66a.76.76 0 0 1 .17-.66L21.58 9h-6c-.5 0-.95-.3-1.15-.75L12 2.64 9.57 8.25c-.2.45-.65.75-1.15.75h-6l4.75 5.35c.16.18.22.43.17.66l-1.48 6.66 5.47-3.4c.21-.12.44-.18.67-.18zm3.81-10.44z" fill="#FFE000"></path></svg></svg></span></i></div></div><h4 class="c-section-title review-title heading-5 v-fw-medium" id="review-id-56d7b921-78df-3900-afc3-bee43614fbe2">Overheating</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" type="button" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay"><svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewBox="0 0 100 100" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs"><svg id="Confirm_Line_Sm" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 21.67c-.26 0-.52-.11-.71-.29l-4.31-4.31a1 1 0 1 1 1.41-1.41l3.54 3.54 7.2-8.5a1 1 0 1 1 1.53 1.29l-7.9 9.33a1 1 0 0 1-.72.35h-.04z"></path></svg></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span><span class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 6, 2021 12:06 PM">1 week ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->less than 1 week<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">****** This review is over the 5 days i have owned this desktop. ***** 
The computer runs pretty nice outside of the CPU overheating. Setting up the computer and updating all programs took roughly 45min. After that i let the computer run idle for about 2 1/2 hours. CPU was running at about 83°c to 90°c. Fan was running loud the entire time. After 4 additional hours of research with windows setting changes to the processor boosts and fan settings showing no sign in cooling off; it finally occurred to me that the thermal paste or fan could be the issue. After removing the Heat sync and fan from the CPU, i was able to determine that the thermal paste was the issue. (Finger prints shown on the top of the unit in the picture are not mine.) After removing and reapplying the thermal paste, it is now running to about 31°-40° idle. 

I have built computers in the past so i felt comfortable opening up the computer. Since this seems common issue, i cannot in good faith tag this as a recommended item. 

GAMERS: This computer runs these games beautifully on highest settings after thermal paste was reapplied (0 fps drops and 0 heating issues):
-Ffxiv
-World of warcraft
-Satisfactory **heavy on CPU usage. 51°-73°c average**
-Icarus
-Kena: Bridge of spirits **somewhat heavy CPU later in the game. 51°-62°c**
These are all i was able to play over the weekend. Happy hunting!</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="rating-group EaseofUse-rating"><div Setting up the computer and updating all programs took roughly 45min. After that i let the computer run idle for about 2 1\u002F2 hours. CPU was running at about 83°c to 90°c. Fan was running loud the entire time. After 4 additional hours of research with windows setting changes to the processor boosts and fan settings showing no sign in cooling off; it finally occurred to me that the thermal paste or fan could be the issue. After removing the Heat sync and fan from the CPU, i was able to determine that the thermal paste was the issue. (Finger prints shown on the top of the unit in the picture are not mine.) After removing and reapplying the thermal paste, it is now running to about 31°-40° idle. \n\nI have built computers in the past so i felt comfortable opening up the computer. Since this seems common issue, i cannot in good faith tag this as a recommended item. \n\nGAMERS: This computer runs these games beautifully on highest settings after thermal paste was reapplied (0 fps drops and 0 heating issues):\n-Ffxiv\n-World of warcraft\n-Satisfactory **heavy on CPU usage. 51°-73°c average**\n-Icarus\n-Kena: Bridge of spirits **somewhat heavy CPU later in the game. 51°-62°c**\nThese are all i was able to play over the weekend. id="review-id-f319f8a0-0632-358b-93cd-3f4c3f965b5f">Very impressed</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" type="button" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay"><svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewBox="0 0 100 100" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs"><svg id="Confirm_Line_Sm" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 21.67c-.26 0-.52-.11-.71-.29l-4.31-4.31a1 1 0 1 1 1.41-1.41l3.54 3.54 7.2-8.5a1 1 0 1 1 1.53 1.29l-7.9 9.33a1 1 0 0 1-.72.35h-.04z"></path></svg></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span><span class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 3, 2021 9:26 AM">1 week ago</time>.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">I've built 4 PC's in the past couple of years and I must say this PC was built with TLC. The packaging was very protective of the PC. The wires were snaked, hidden, zip tied and taped! We checked all the screws as we heard some people say things aren't always tightened or ram not pushed in all the way. There wasn't any of that here. The only con that would make me want to take half a star away is that the case has no room (physically) for expansion. It's so thin that you can't add a AIO cooler for the CPU. It comes with one fan and the heatsink has one fan.... and you can only add two more generic fans because the motherboard only has two more pins. We went into the bios and increased fan speeds to help with the potential cooling issues we forsee, but we will have to buy two more generic fans. There is no room for an HDD there are no brackets to hold one in place. You "could" put one in as the motherboard has the pins for it but it will physically just be hanging there. The only (1) NVMe is being used for this device and it felt like it was thermal pasted to the  shield covering it.

TLDR perfect for those that:
Want a quality build 
Want great parts NOW for a cheap bundle price
No fuss start it. Literally boots windows 11 on start.
Awesome looking case with very sturdy handle

Cons:
If you plan on pushing the CPU you probably need to buy two more generic fans (cheap)
You should go into bios and adjust fan speed according to load you are putting on CPU too.
Case has limited/no room for expansion (physically) for HDD and AIO cooler (or at least the cheaper $100 AIO I bought).</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="rating-group EaseofUse-rating"><div class="rating-description">Ease of Use</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="rating-group Quality-rating"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"http:\u002F\u002Fschema.org\u002F","@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"Product","name":"ASUS - ROG Gaming Desktop - Intel Core i7-11700KF - 16GB Memory - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 - 1TB SSD"},"name":"Very impressed","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jayman382"},"reviewBody":"I've built 4 PC's in the past couple of years and I must say this PC was built with TLC. The packaging was very protective of the PC. The wires were snaked, hidden, zip tied and taped! We checked all the screws as we heard some people say things aren't always tightened or ram not pushed in all the way. There wasn't any of that here. The only con that would make me want to take half a star away is that the case has no room (physically) for expansion. It's so thin that you can't add a AIO cooler for the CPU. It comes with one fan and the heatsink has one fan.... and you can only add two more generic fans because the motherboard only has two more pins. We went into the bios and increased fan speeds to help with the potential cooling issues we forsee, but we will have to buy two more generic fans. There is no room for an HDD there are no brackets to hold one in place. You \"could\" put one in as the motherboard has the pins for it but it will physically just be hanging there. The only (1) NVMe is being used for this device and it felt like it was thermal pasted to the  shield covering it.\n\nTLDR perfect for those that:\nWant a quality build \nWant great parts NOW for a cheap bundle price\nNo fuss start it. Literally boots windows 11 on start.\nAwesome looking case with very sturdy handle\n\nCons:\nIf you plan on pushing the CPU you probably need to buy two more generic fans (cheap)\nYou should go into bios and adjust fan speed according to load you are putting on CPU too.\nCase has limited\u002Fno room for expansion (physically) for HDD and AIO cooler (or at least the cheaper $100 AIO I bought).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4,"bestRating":"5"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Best Buy"}}</script></li><li class="review-item" tabindex="-1"><div viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 3, 2021 11:49 PM">1 week ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->less than 1 week<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">So initial review of the case it looks nice, a lot of RGB lighting effects unfortunately looks are deceving in this case. The fans are obnoxiously loud probably the loudest I have ever heard so they will definitely need to be replaced. There is only one little intake fan so there is no air coming into the case this is going to have to change. Also the core temperature on the CPU gets well above 100 degrees celcius which is beyond overheating so there is definitely going to have to an AIO installed. The ram used in the PC is a basic/generic ram that will also have to go. Basically what you are paying for in this PC is the GPU &amp; the CPU which isn't the greatest but gets the job done. I haven't taken this case apart yet but have ordered several additions that I will be adding over the coming weeks to allow this rig to come to life.</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="rating-group EaseofUse-rating"><div class="rating-description">Ease of Use</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="rating-group Quality-rating"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="ugc-brand-response-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">
Dear Frawst,<br><br>We'e sorry to hear about the overheating issues you're having with this model. You stated that the fan is loud, is it only when performing a specific task? If the temperature in the room is higher than 80 or 90 degress fahrenheit, we would recommend relocating the PC to lower temperature. Also, sometimes the system may be operating as intended, but the unit is placed on a desk with the monitor or in a location that makes the noise more apparent, we would recommend that you changing the orientaion of the unit so that the vents and fan noise are not directed towards the user, moving the system to a location like under the desk, or moving the unit further from the user if possible.  Watch out for any issues at the new location though as mentioned in the previous bullet point. Placing the system under the desk on carpet can block vents under the unit as well as introduce more dust, so additional action may be needed to deal with those possible issues. If the issue persist, we would recommend that you have this model sent in for servicing. <br>For more information send us an email at customerloyalty@asus.com and provide the link of this review for reference. We’ll do our best to provide a quick resolution to your case. Your feedback is important as it helps with improvements to ASUS Support channels. Please copy a link to this post as a reference.<br>Thank you for choosing ASUS.<br><br>Best Regards,<br>Joan<br>ASUS Customer Loyalty US Support

class="ugc-brand-response-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">
Dear Alex,<br><br>We do understand your concern with the fan noise and the thermal issues. <br><br><br><br>It is normal for the PC, with the same hardware configuration and regardless of the manufacturer, to generate more heat than normal while under heavy load especially during gaming, WINDOWS Update and antivirus scan. When system resource utilization is high, this will generate more heat than normal and tends to trigger the fan to spin at full-throttle. Please check if the air ventilations are free from obstructions in order to have an efficient air flow for better heat dissipation. Also, while gaming, please ensure no resource hungry applications are running in the background, this will definitely spike the temperature. The heat or temperature does decreases or normalizes once system resource utilization goes down.<br><br><br><br>Should you need further assistance with the product, please email me at cl-rodel@asus.com and I would be more than happy to help. Or, you are most welcome to call Product Support Hotline at: 1(888) 678-3688. Also, you can chat with an ASUS live support agent at:&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/AsusLiveChat" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" style="word-break: break-all;">http://bit.ly/AsusLiveChat</a>.<br> <br>Thank you for choosing an ASUS product.<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Rodel<br>ASUS Customer Loyalty

id="review-id-cedf2219-61b6-30bc-b722-d2b276dd3cf1">Disappointed for $2000</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" type="button" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay"><svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewBox="0 0 100 100" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs"><svg id="Confirm_Line_Sm" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 2, 2021 9:20 PM">1 week ago</time>.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Picked mine up today. Couple of things. Keyboard and Mouse that came with it are not the ones pictured. 
My computer shipped with a single stick of ddr4 ram. Not two sticks to run in dual channel.
Seems like it received a slight upgrade compared to pictures as far as cup cooler goes. Looks like a knock off hyper 212 evo
When removing it from the package it sounded like there was a screw just rolling around in the case. Turns out there was. I assume it was dropped during the build process. Takes 1 minute to find it and remove it. It wasn't.

I have never in my life recommended to anyone to buy a prebuilt. However with the current situation as far as inflation. It almost makes sense. Honestly for $2000 I was disappointed.

Unit did ship with a good motherboard and decent GPU. 

ASUS ROG STRIX B560-G GAMING Wi-Fi and an 

ASUS Dual RTX 3070 V2 OC LHR Gaming Graphics Card 8GB GDDR6 HDMI DP PCIe 4.0</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="rating-group Quality-rating"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">2 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div Dear KolbyBayes,<br><br>We certainly understand your disappointment and the inconvenience this may have caused. <br><br><br><br>All ASUS products undergo intensive quality control testing and inspections, the loose screw inside the desktop PC is a random problem. <br><br><br><br>If you need further assistance with the product, please email me at cl-rodel@asus.com and I would be more than happy to help. Fan was running loud the entire time. After 4 additional hours of research with windows setting changes to the processor boosts and fan settings showing no sign in cooling off; it finally occurred to me that the thermal paste or fan could be the issue. After removing and reapplying the thermal paste, it is now running to about 31°-40° idle. \\n\\nI have built computers in the past so i felt comfortable opening up the computer. Setting up the computer and updating all programs took roughly 45min. After that i let the computer run idle for about 2 1\\u002F2 hours. CPU was running at about 83°c to 90°c. Fan was running loud the entire time. After 4 additional hours of research with windows setting changes to the processor boosts and fan settings showing no sign in cooling off; it finally occurred to me that the thermal paste or fan could be the issue. After removing the Heat sync and fan from the CPU, i was able to determine that the thermal paste was the issue. (Finger prints shown on the top of the unit in the picture are not mine.) After removing and reapplying the thermal paste, it is now running to about 31°-40° idle. \\n\\nI have built computers in the past so i felt comfortable opening up the computer. Since this seems common issue, i cannot in good faith tag this as a recommended item. \\n\\nGAMERS: This computer runs these games beautifully on highest settings after thermal paste was reapplied (0 fps drops and 0 heating issues):\\n-Ffxiv\\n-World of warcraft\\n-Satisfactory **heavy on CPU usage. 51°-73°c average**\\n-Icarus\\n-Kena: Bridge of spirits **somewhat heavy CPU later in the game. 51°-62°c**\\nThese are all i was able to play over the weekend. under heavy load especially during gaming, WINDOWS Update and antivirus scan. class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/asus-rog-gaming-desktop-intel-core-i7-11700kf-16gb-memory-nvidia-geforce-rtx-3070-1tb-ssd/6477649/question/00bc7ee7-a07a-3b8d-bf72-c70dfdc0d561" id="question-00bc7ee7-a07a-3b8d-bf72-c70dfdc0d561">What type of ram? Dual channel or single 16? The one i just got has single. It is not clear in the specs. the online pics show 4 ram slots full. i uploaded a pic on my single channel.</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 15, 2021 7:23 PM">1 month ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->MinusD123<!-- -->.</span></p><div class="image-carousel"><div class="nav-wrapper false false page-size-eight"><ul class="image-list no-nav"><li><button class="c-button-link selected" type="button" data-track="QnA: Question: Image"><img alt="Customer provided image, click to load a larger version" src="https://photos-us.bazaarvoice.com/photo/2/cGhvdG86YmVzdGJ1eQ/e18d560a-7cce-5b54-9377-05663fc644a5"></button></li><li><button class="c-button-link " type="button" data-track="QnA: Question: Image"><img alt="Customer provided image, click to load a larger version" src="https://photos-us.bazaarvoice.com/photo/2/cGhvdG86YmVzdGJ1eQ/5e897866-fdff-55f0-a647-b47b19153e9b"></button></li></ul></div></div><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="44bacd6e-b099-33f6-955c-75af4e30da67" id="answer-44bacd6e-b099-33f6-955c-75af4e30da67" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>Single channel 16. Feel free to go get another single stick of 16gb to toss into it. Mix-matching isn't the snafu it is claimed to be when it comes down to performance.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 26, 2021 3:54 PM">2
